The temperature record is an average.
Some places were a bit cooler than normal, Siberia, for example.
Other places were mind-bogglingly hot.
A temperature in Kuwait on July 22 reached 126.5 degrees Fahrenheit, according to an observation taken by the United States Air Force.

This year, it was 1.5 degrees Fahrenheit warmer.
And the U.S.
has by and large sizzled along with the rest of the world.

was warmer than average for 2016 so far, with a lot of that warmth situated across the northern tier and in the West.
